data.title: Outstanding new restaurant and bar!
data.text:
This is one of the newest, upscale places to grab a drink and a bite to eat in downtown Gresham. Happy Hour has a specialized list of classic cocktails and cocktails, with a twist. They also have a short, but tasty classic menu that definitely hits the mark. 

The decor is very classy, and has a nice atmosphere that brings a fresh look to the up and coming downtown area of Gresham. Our town is in need of a nice place like this to meet, hang out, or meet for a business lunch or dinner.

I decided to order the Bomb Gin. It was sooooo good! My girlfriend ordered a Manhattan. The bartender told us they were out of Maker's Mark, and they recommended a great alternative: Bulleit Rye. Fantastic!

As for our food, we shared a green salad, mini-chicken pot pie, and sirloin steak with sautéed mushrooms, garlic mashed potatoes, and grilled asparagus...a.k.a The Paleo Plate. It is all home made and delicious! The steak was cooked to perfection and everything paired well with our tasty drinks.

I definitely recommend this restaurant to everyone! Gresham has been in need of a great place like this for some time!!!

data.title: Weeknight cocktails
data.text:
We've been waiting for the opening of this corner establishment on Main and 4th.
Stopped in to have a drink and check out the menu.
Beautiful new barstools in bright orange and comfy white leather chairs in a retro lounge.  
The bar top had dirty glasses and trays so not very inviting on this visit.
Service is friendly and understated.
Perfect cosmo served in chilled stainless steel martini stems. We shared grilled brussel sprouts with a spicy creamy dip and deviled eggs, delicious.  
We will return when the menu is filled out, they are offering skewers with vegis  and starchy sides now and beautiful salads.Desserts and coffee.

data.title: You Must Go to Happy Hour!
data.text:
Loved this place!  It is a cute, modern, take on traditional comfort food.  My girlfriends and I shared several of the "Happytizers".  All of them were delicious, but I strongly recommend the deviled eggs, fried green beans, and brussels sprouts.  I have to admit, I was a bit skeptical about ordering deviled eggs at a restaurant, but they are incredible!  The perfect texture and  taste!  Normally, I find the mayo in deviled eggs overpowering, but not in Happy  Hour's eggs.  The breading on the green beans was just right.  It was crisp, flavorful and not soggy at all.  As for the brussels sprouts, we were fighting over who got the last one.  

The cocktails were all delicious!  The bartender clearly knows how to mix a drink.  We each tried several of the cocktails.  I loved the Happy Hibiscus and the Gimlet.  They also have a great selection of Mocktails for your designated driver.  I tried the "Yup!" and it was so yummy!  Next time I visit Happy Hour, I'm ordering it with vodka.  

I will definitely be back to Happy Hour!  The great food, cocktails, and service make this place a must go!

data.title: Loving this new spot in Gresham
data.text: Loving this bar. Great place to grab an amazing cocktail and delicious bite to eat. My personal favorite is the Mactini with either the chip and dip or the fried green beans as the "happytizer". So good! And love the atmosphere. Cozy yet modern. Excited to have this new addition in Gresham family.  Oh and don't forget to try their desserts....delightful!

data.title: Good times
data.text: We went to the happy hour expecting a good time and everything was delivered love the lemon drops had the deep fried beans (not on my diet but hence the good times🐷) were just delicious love them💓

owner_response.author: , Public Relations Manager at Happy Hour, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello Walter,
  Thank you for coming to Happy Hour.  I'm so glad to hear you had such a wonderful experience! Yes, those green beans are trouble. Don't forget to come back soon when we have our extended menu with even more diet-breakers available.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Tasty new option!
data.text:
Happy Hour has a fun 60s vibe with a menu unlike anything else in the Gresham area. I love comfort food and was excited to see mac and cheese and mashed potatoes on the menu! I wanted to try a little of everything so ordered the mac which came with a skewer of grilled chicken, the brussel sprouts (served fried with a delicious aioli for dipping), and the caprese sandwich, which was loaded with mozzarella, cream cheese, tomatoes, and fresh basil. I also tried a friends chips and artichoke dip- the chips were house made and still warm, and the dip was cheesy and flavorful. 

All the food I tried was 10/10, seriously delicious. Kudos to the owner Shelley and her cooks! I'm so excited to have a new local hangout.

Also, they have a creative mocktail menu- the "Beyoncé" tho! 🙌

owner_response.author: , Public Relations Manager at Happy Hour, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello Matt,
   Thank you so much for coming by Happy Hour and for taking your time to write such a wonderful review. We are so happy to hear that your experience is the goal we have for all of our guests. Thank you again and we can't wait to have you back!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Dinner and drinks
data.text:
Absolutly fantastic......deep fried beans are just delish..... Just opened and the menu, while short still, is fantastic.
Lemon drops are fresh squeezed and reflect the establishment. When you visit say hi to Shelly she will love it.

owner_response.author: , Public Relations Manager at Happy Hour, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hello Pati,
   Thank you for your wonderful review and for coming to Happy Hour! Our extended menu should be available in a week or so, so be sure to come by again and try even more goodies!
owner_response.title: Owner Response
